name.description: Company name or name listed on the applicable address as presented in RCRAInfo

address_1.description: Address line 1 listed on the applicable address as presented in RCRAInfo

address_2.description: Address line 2 listed on the applicable address as presented in RCRAInfo

city.description: City name listed on the applicable address as presented in RCRAInfo

state.description: Two character abbreviation for State or Province listed on the applicable address as presented in RCRAInfo

country.description: Name of Country, optional for domestic shipments listed on the applicable address as presented in RCRAInfo

zip_code.description: Postal Code listed on the applicable address as presented in RCRAInfo

handler_defined_datum.description: Industry requested optional field for tracking information not specifically on the manifest, but needed by the users.  In order to use this field handlers must define the description, content and the handler who requested this information be placed on the manifest.

label.description: Label for the handler defined data.  This label is for the use of the handler for labeling the content of non-manifest related items.

content.description: handler defined content, this field may be used for holding and/or describing special ids, purchase orders, or other non-manifest related items.  This field is where the data related to the handler defined field is inputted.

us_epa_id_number.description: Handler Id number of entity using this individual handler defined data.  The id is used to ensure uniqueness, assist in retrieval, and avoid confusion if two companies use the same label.

line_item_number.description: Line item number that corespondes to a manifest line item on the paper form.

hazardous_material.description: (9a) Indication if the waste is a hazardous material per the Department of transportation

proper_shipping_name.description: (9b) Proper shipping name as directed by US Department Of Transportation

id_number.description: (9b) List of Hazard materials UN/NA identification number as defined internationally and by the US Department of Transportation

packing_group.description: (9b) Packing group defined by the US Department of Transportation

items.description: (9b) List of Hazard classes as defined by the US Department of Transportation
items.COMMENT: DOT Enumerated Values, I would like to see if there is a service for these.  There are around 26 of these

total_quantity.description: (11) Total quantity for the listed unit of measure

unit_wt_vol.description: (12) List of codes for unit measure as described the e-Manifest instructions

number_of_containers.description: (10) number of containers identified by container type

container_type.description: (10) List of codes for type of container used in as described the e-Manifest instructions.  For containers not listed in the instructions user may use the NL code.  If using the NL code the user must describe the container being used.

report_management_method_codes.description: (19) Federal Management method codes as listed in EPA guidance.

items.description: (13) State waste codes as per state regulations

State.description: State that owns and mandates this waste code be used on the manifest

items.description: (13) Federal EPA waste codes as listed in the regulations

waste_handling_instruction_item.description: (14) Special Handling instructions on the manifest form.

emergency_response_phone_item.description: Emergency Phone number for each waste line if used.

emergency_response_manual_id.description: Emergency manual id number for each waste line if used.

consent_number.description: Imports and Exports ONLY. Consent number provided so that the waste can be exported out of a country.

form_code.description: Currently optional, EPA will at a later date work with industry and states to integrate e-Manifest and the Bienial Report place to the form code for the waste stream

source_code.description: Currently optional, EPA will at a later date work with industry and states to integrate e-Manifest and the Bienial Report place to the source code for the waste stream
source_code.COMMENT: pattern does not match min/max length (only 3 chars defined)

density.description: Currently optional, EPA will at a later date work with industry and states to integrate e-Manifest and the Bienial Report field captures the density and whether the density is measured in pounds per gallon or specific gravity.

measurement.description: Field stating how the density of the material is measured.  The values can either be in pounds per gallon or uses specific gravity.

telephone_number_data_type.description: 15 alphanumberic string accounting for international numbers e.g. +001 1234321234, to be honest this is just a safety feature, most will be standard 10 digit

name.description: (6,7) Transporter company name as presented in RCRAInfo

us_epa_id_number.description: (6,7) Unique tracking number assigned to each RCRA Handler/Site.  Starts with 2 or 3 Letters and ends with 9 or 10 numbers

signatory.description: (17) Transporter acknowledgement of reciept of materials signature information

us_epa_id_number.description: Unique tracking number assigned to each RCRA Handler/Site. Starts with 2 or 3 Letters and ends with 9 or 10 numbers.  A future release will address CESQG numbers at a later date.

manifest_tracking_number.description: (4) Unique tracking number assigned to each manifest.  Starts with 9 numbers and ends with 3 Letters

us_epa_id_number.description: (1) Unique tracking number assigned to each RCRA Handler/Site. Starts with 2 or 3 Letters and ends with 9 or 10 numbers

mailing_address.description: (5) Generator mailing address as presented in RCRAInfo

site_address.description: (5) Generator site address as presented in RCRAInfo

no_us_epa_id_number.description: (1) Optional, Indicator whether the generator or site has a us_epa_id_number

signatory.description: (17) Transporter acknowledgement of reciept of materials signature information

port_of_entry_exit.description: (16) City and State of point of entry or export.

city.description: (16) City of point of entry or export.

state.description: (16) State of point of entry or export.

us_epa_id_number.description: (8) Unique tracking number assigned to each RCRA Handler/Site. Starts with 2 or 3 Letters and ends with 9 or 10 numbers

certification.description: (20) Designated facility owner or operator: Certification of receipt of hazardous materials covered by the manifest except as noted in Item 18a signature information

address.description: (8) designated facility address as presented in RCRAInfo

new_manifest_tracking_number.description: (18a) If a new manifest is created due to the rejection of manifested waste. This is where the new manifest ID goes.

us_epa_id_number.description: (18b) Unique tracking number assigned to each RCRA Handler/Site. Starts with 2 or 3 Letters and ends with 9 or 10 numbers

category_quantity.description: (18a) Indication if the discrepency is due to quantity

category_type.description: (18a) Indication if the discrepency is due to type of waste recieved

category_residue.description: (18a) Indication if the discrepency is due to residues

type.description: (18a) Type of rejection, no, partial, or full rejection

address.description: (18b) Alternate facility address as presented in RCRAInfo

waste_pcb_description.description: Included in item (14) Special Handling instructions on the manifest form. Use this field for required PCB information. PCB manifest requirements need further user needs analysis.  This will be handled in a future release.

number_of_pages.description: (2) Number of Pages on manifest (paper manifests only).

waste_non_hazardous_material_present.description: (9) Boolean to state if the manifest has US Department of Transportation nonhazardous materials indicated on the form

waste_handling_instructions.description: (14) Special Handling instructions on the manifest form.  For electronic manifests, please note that there are additional fields that support manifest item 14, such as waste_pcb_description and handler_defined_data.

content.description: Base 64 encoded pdf file for upload to e-Manifest.  This field is for a paper manifest where the industry user chooses to upload a scanned manifest.  The industry user must convert the pdf file to base64 encoding before uploading the file. Please note, a file while it may have more than one page, a file can only contain one manifest.

content_type.description: File type of the file being uploaded.  The only option offered is PDF.

file_name.description: The file name of the manifest upload file. Please note, a file while it may have more than one page, a file can only contain one manifest
